title: Waverley; Or 'Tis Sixty Years Since - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: At the foot of this eminence, which is almost as famous forwitch meetings as the neighbouring wind-mill of Kippilaw, Dick wassomewhat startled to observe that his conductor entered thehillside by a passage or cavern, of which he himself, though wellacquainted with the spot, had never seen or heard.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: I begin to think which of his namesakes this omen concerns, for I take Walter Kerr of Kippilaw to be out of the question.
